sourceMeaningMnemonic: The radical <radical>suit</radical> and the kanji <kanji>suit</kanji> are exactly the same! This kanji can also mean <kanji>join</kanji> which makes sense. When something suits you well, like a hat or something, it joins together with you quite well too. Join me, my hat! You suit my head well. It just <kanji>fit</kanji>s, you know?
meaningInfo: Just remember that this "suit" means "to suit you" - not the thing you wear, okay!
readingMnemonic:
You need someone who will <kanji>suit</kanji> you. Someone who can <kanji>join</kanji> you on your life journey. So you call Grandpa <ja><reading>ごう</reading>いち</ja>.

Note: For the <ja>ごう</ja> reading mnemonics, we use Grandpa <ja>ごういち</ja> because <ja>こういち</ja> is used for the <ja>こう</ja> reading. So just remember that <ja>ごう</ja> comes from Koichi's grandpa <ja>ごういち</ja>.
readingInfo: Imagine you two standing next to each other, posing for a photograph. You two suit each other well. Grandpa <ja>ごういち</ja> with his gray beard, and you with your [well, you have to fill in this part by yourself].
